level.text: The Mayor shall establish and maintain a searchable electronic database available through the Internet that, at a minimum, contains the Construction Codes Supplement, set forth in Title 12 of the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations, and any amendments made thereto, to the:
Council of American Building Officials One and Two Family Dwelling Code/1995;
National Fire Protection Association National Electrical Code/1996; and
The Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs shall make the information in the database available to any person.

level.heading: Temporary Repeal of Section
level.text: Section 3(b) of D.C. Law 19-181 repealed this section.
Section 11(b) of D.C. Law 19-181 provides that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.

level.heading: Emergency Act Amendments
level.text: For temporary (90 day) repeal of section, see § 3(b) of the Sign Regulation Emergency Amendment Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-387, July 11, 2012, 59 DCR 8491).
For temporary (90 day) repeal of section, see § 3(b) of Sign Regulation Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-499, October 26, 2012, 59 DCR 12749).

level.heading: Miscellaneous Notes
level.text: Section 301 of D.C. Law 14-162 provides: "Pursuant to Title I of the District of Columbia Administrative Procedure Act, approved October 21, 1968 (82 Stat. 1204; D.C. Official Code § 2-501 et seq.), the Mayor may issue rules to implement the provisions of this act."
